alert.note: Alert for Catawba (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 7:47PM EDT until September 30 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Catawba. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 745 PM EDT, As heavy tropical showers continue to overspread the region this evening, rainfall totals could approach 2.5 or 3 inches in spots, mainly south of I-40. Across these locales, remain wary of rising stream levels and high water conditions this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hickory, Newton, St. Stephens, Conover, Longview, Maiden, Claremont, Catawba, Lookout Shoals Lake, Lake Hickory, Mountain View, Lake Norman, Sherrills Ford, Startown, Bandys, Oxford, Propst, Terrell and Cooksville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
